applymovementpos.description: Apparent clone of applymovement. Oddly, it doesn't seem to work at all if applied to any Person other than the player (0xFF), and the X and Y arguments don't seem to do anything.

special.description: Calls a special function; that is, a piece of ASM code designed for use by scripts and listed in a table of pointers.

setwarpplace.description: Sets a default warp place. If a warp tries to send the player to Warp 127 on Map 127.127, they will instead be sent here. Useful when a map has warps that need to go to script-controlled locations (i.e. elevators).

setweather.description: Queues a weather change to type weather.

preparemsg.description: Starts displaying a standard message box containing the specified text. If text is a pointer, then the string at that offset will be loaded and used. If text is script bank 0, then the value of script bank 0 will be treated as a pointer to the text. (You can use loadpointer to place a string pointer in a script bank.)

checksound.description: Blocks script execution until the currently-playing sound (triggered by sound) finishes playing.

hidecoins.description: Hides the secondary box spawned by showcoins. It doesn't appear to use its arguments, but they are still required.

bufferitems.description: Writes the name of the specified (item) item to the specified buffer. If the specified item is a Berry (0x85 - 0xAE) or Poke Ball (0x4) and if the quantity is 2 or more, the buffered string will be pluralized ("IES" or "S" appended). If the specified item is the Enigma Berry, I have no idea what this command does (but testing showed no pluralization). If the specified index is larger than the number of items in the game (0x176), the name of item 0 ("????????") is buffered instead.

warp6.description: Clone of warp... Except that it doesn't appear to have any effect when used in some of FireRed's default level scripts. (If it did, Berry Forest would be impossible to enter...)

removeitem.description: Removes quantity of item index from the player's Bag.

setdoorclosed2.description: Queues the closing of the door tile at (X, Y) without an animation.

setworldmapflag.description: Sets worldmapflag to 1. This allows the player to Fly to the corresponding map, if that map has a flightspot.

showpokepic.description: Displays a box containing the front sprite for the specified (species) Pokémon species.

setobedience.description: Makes the Pokémon in the specified slot of the player's party obedient. It will not randomly disobey orders in battle.

countPok\u00e9mon.description: Retrieves the number of Pokémon in the player's party, and stores that number in variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT).

doanimation.description: Executes the specified field move animation.

getplayerpos.description: Retrieves the player's zero-indexed X- and Y-coordinates in the map, and stores them in the specified variables.

hidespritepos.description: Clone of hidesprite that also moves the Person? Test it!

callstdif.description: If the result of the last comparison matches condition (see Comparison operators), calls the standard function at index function.

showcontestresults.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

comparefarbytetobyte.description: Compares the byte located at offset a to a fixed byte value (b).

pokemart.description: Opens the Pokemart system, offering the specified products for sale.

compare.description: Compares the value of a to a fixed word value (b).

textcolor.description: Sets the color of the text in standard message boxes. 0x00 produces blue (male) text, 0x01 produces red (female) text, 0xFF resets the color to the default for the current OW's gender, and all other values produce black text.

bufferdecoration.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop. (The first argument is discarded immediately. The second argument is read, but not used for anything.)

waitfanfare.description: Blocks script execution until all currently-playing fanfares finish.

copybyte.description: Copies the byte at source to destination, replacing whatever byte was previously there.

executeram.description: Depending on factors I haven't managed to understand yet, this command may cause script execution to jump to the offset specified by the pointer at 0x020370A4.

contestlinktransfer.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

sound.description: Plays the specified (sound_number) sound. Only one sound may play at a time, with newer ones interrupting older ones.

resetvars.description: Resets the values of variables 0x8000, 0x8001, and 0x8002.

givepokemon.description: Gives the player one of the specified (species) Pokémon at level level holding item. The unknown arguments should all be zeroes.

comparebanktobyte.description: Compares the least-significant byte of the value of script bank a to a fixed byte value (b).

warphole.description: Warps the player to another map using a hole animation. It doesn't accept warp numbers or X/Y coordinates, so where does it send the player? Same (X, Y) as when the command is triggered?

paymoney.description: If check is 0x00, this command subtracts value from the player's money.

setmaptile.description: Changes the tile at (X, Y) on the current map.

setcatchlocation.description: Changes the location where the player caught the Pokémon in the specified slot of their party. A list of valid catch locations can be found on PokeCommunity.

checkitem.description: Checks if the player has quantity or more of item index in their Bag. Sets variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT) to 0x0001 if the player has enough of the item, or 0x0000 if they have fewer than quantity of the item.

bufferpartyPok\u00e9mon.description: Writes the name of the Pokémon in slot slot (zero-indexed) of the player's party to the specified buffer. If an empty or invalid slot is specified, ten spaces ("          ") are written to the buffer.

cmdd5.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

checkmoney.description: If check is 0x00, this command will check if the player has value or more money; script variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT) is set to 0x0001 if the player has enough money, or 0x0000 if the do not.

pause.description: Blocks script execution for time (frames? milliseconds?).

waitkeypress.description: Blocks script execution until the player presses any key.

fadein.description: Fades the currently-playing song back in.

setdooropened2.description: Queues the opening of the door tile at (X, Y) without an animation.

warp3.description: Clone of warp. Used by an (unused?) Safari Zone script to return the player to the gatehouse and end the Safari Game.

comparebanks.description: Compares the values of script banks a and b, after forcing the values to bytes.

waitmovement.description: Blocks script execution until the movements being applied to the specified (index) Person event finish. If the specified Person event is 0x0000, then the command will block script execution until all Person events affected by applymovement finish their movements. If the specified Person event is not currently being manipulated with applymovement, then this command does nothing.

repeattrainerbattle.description: Starts a trainer battle using the battle information stored in RAM (usually by trainerbattle, which actually calls this command behind-the-scenes), and blocks script execution until the battle finishes.

special2.description: Calls a special function. That function's output (if any) will be written to the variable you specify.

checktrainerflag.description: Compares Flag (trainer + 0x500) to 1. (If the flag is set, then the trainer has been defeated by the player.)

sethealingplace.description: Sets which healing place the player will return to if all of the Pokémon in their party faint. A list of available healing places can be found on PokeCommunity.

adddecoration.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop. (The argument is read, but not used for anything.)

callstd.description: Calls the standard function at index function.

additem.description: Attempts to add quantity of item index to the player's Bag. If the player has enough room, the item will be added and variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT) will be set to 0x0001; otherwise, LASTRESULT is set to 0x0000.

cmdb2.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

settrainerflag.description: Clears Flag (trainer + 0x500). (I didn't make a mistake. The command names actually are backwards.)

checkitemtype.description: Checks which Bag pocket the specified (index) item belongs in, and writes the value to variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT). This script is used to show the name of the proper Bag pocket when the player receives an item via callstd (simplified to giveitem in XSE).

callasm.description: Calls the ASM routine stored at code. Script execution is blocked until the ASM returns (bx lr, mov pc, lr, etc.). Remember to add 1 to the offset when calling THUMB code.

comparehiddenvar.description: Compares the value of a hidden variable to a dword.

setwildbattle.description: Prepares to start a wild battle against a species at Level level holding item. Running this command will not affect normal wild battles. You start the prepared battle with dowildbattle.

copyvar.description: Copies the value of source into destination.

setfarbyte.description: Not sure. Judging from XSE's description I think it takes the least-significant byte in bank source and writes it to destination.

lockall.description: Ceases movement for all OWs on-screen.

comparebanktofarbyte.description: Compares the least-significant byte of the value of script bank a to the byte located at offset b.

normalmsg.description: Ends the effects of signmsg, returning message box frames to normal.

cmda6.description: This command manages cases in which maps have tiles that change state when stepped on (specifically, cracked/breakable floors).

cmdb1.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

warpmuted.description: Clone of warp that does not play a sound effect.

fadescreen.description: Fades the screen to black or back, using the specified effect. Effect 0x00 fades in, and effect 0x01 fades out. I don't know if other effects exist.

bufferitem.description: Writes the name of the item at index item to the specified buffer. If the specified index is larger than the number of items in the game (0x176), the name of item 0 ("????????") is buffered instead.

return.description: Jumps back to after the last-executed call statement, and continues script execution from there.

fadedefault.description: Crossfades the currently-playing song into the map's default song.

gotostd.description: Jumps to the standard function at index function.

hidesprite.description: Attempts to hide the specified (local_ID, a local ID) Person event on the current map, by setting its visibility flag if it has a valid one. If the Person does not have a valid visibility flag, this command does nothing.

loadbytefrompointer.description: Copies the byte value at source into the specified script bank.

removedecoration.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop. (The argument is read, but not used for anything.)

warp5.description: Clone of warp3, except that this writes data to different offsets...

signmsg.description: After using this command, all standard message boxes will use the signpost frame.

checkgender.description: Checks the player's gender. If male, then 0x0000 is stored in variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT). If female, then 0x0001 is stored in LASTRESULT.

updatemoney.description: Updates the secondary box spawned by showmoney. (What does it do with its arguments?)

releaseall.description: Resumes normal movement for all OWs on-screen, and closes any standard message boxes that are still open.

copyvarifnotzero.description: If source is not a variable, then this function acts like setvar. Otherwise, it acts like copyvar.

jumpram.description: Executes a script stored in a default RAM location.

multichoice.description: Displays a multichoice box from which the user can choose a selection, and blocks script execution until a selection is made. Lists of options are predefined and the one to be used is specified with list. If B is set to a non-zero value, then the user will not be allowed to back out of the multichoice with the B button.

faceplayer.description: If the script was called by a Person event, then that Person will turn to face toward the tile that the player is stepping off of.

waitmsg.description: If a standard message box (or its text) is being drawn on-screen, this command blocks script execution until the box and its text have been fully drawn.

if2.description: If the result of the last comparison matches condition (see Comparison operators), calls destination.

warpteleport2.description: Clone of warpteleport? It is apparently only used in FR/LG, and only with specials.[source]

showmoney.description: Spawns a secondary box showing how much money the player has.

bufferattack.description: Writes the name of the attack at index attack to the specified buffer.

cmd96.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

gotostdif.description: If the result of the last comparison matches condition (see Comparison operators), jumps to the standard function at index function.

bufferboxname.description: Writes the name of the specified (box) PC box to the specified buffer.

hidemoney.description: Hides the secondary box spawned by showmoney.

choosecontestpkmn.description: In FireRed, this command sets the byte at 0x03000EA8 to 0x01. I do not know what that means.

multichoice3.description: Displays a multichoice box from which the user can choose a selection, and blocks script execution until a selection is made. Lists of options are predefined and the one to be used is specified with list. The per_row argument determines how many list items will be shown on a single row of the box.

if1.description: If the result of the last comparison matches condition (see Comparison operators), jumps to destination and continues script execution from there.

checkobedience.description: Checks if the Pokémon in the specified slot of the player's party is obedient. If the Pokémon is disobedient, 0x0001 is written to script variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT). If the Pokémon is obedient (or if the specified slot is empty or invalid), 0x0000 is written.

showcoins.description: Spawns a secondary box showing how many Coins the player has.

yesnobox.description: Displays a YES/NO multichoice box at the specified coordinates, and blocks script execution until the user makes a selection. Their selection is stored in variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT); 0x0000 for "NO" or if the user pressed B, and 0x0001 for "YES".

setbyte2.description: Sets the specified script bank to value.

bufferstd.description: Writes the standard string identified by index to the specified buffer. Specifying an invalid standard string (e.x. 0x2B) can and usually will cause data corruption (I've observed destruction of the stored player name and crashes when entering/exiting certain menu screens).

warpwalk.description: Clone of warp that uses "a walking effect".

dowildbattle.description: Starts a wild battle against the Pokémon generated by setwildbattle. Blocks script execution until the battle finishes.

playsong.description: Plays the specified (song_number) song. The byte is apparently supposed to be 0x00.

cmdc8.description: The exact purpose of this command is unknown, but it is related to the blue help-text box that appears on the bottom of the screen when the Main Menu is opened.

warp4.description: Clone of warp3, except that this writes data to different offsets...

killscript.description: Terminates script execution and "resets the script RAM".

waitstate.description: Blocks script execution until a command or ASM code manually unblocks it. Generally used with specific commands and specials. If this command runs, and a subsequent command or piece of ASM does not unblock state, the script will remain blocked indefinitely (essentially a hang).

checkdecoration.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop. (The argument is read, but not used for anything.)

addvar.description: Changes the value of destination by adding value to it. Overflow is not prevented (0xFFFF + 1 = 0x0000).

cleartrainerflag.description: Sets Flag (trainer + 0x500). (I didn't make a mistake. The command names actually are backwards.)

subvar.description: Changes the value of destination by subtracting value to it. Overflow is not prevented (0x0000 - 1 = 0xFFFF).

cmdc3.description: Increases the value of the specified hidden variable by 1. The hidden variable's value will not be allowed to exceed 0x00FFFFFF.

applymovement.description: Applies the movement data at movements to the specified (index) Person event. Also closes any standard message boxes that are still open.

comparevars.description: Compares the value of a to the value of b.

warpteleport.description: Clone of warp that uses a teleport effect. It is apparently only used in R/S/E.[source]

waitcry.description: Blocks script execution until cry finishes.

resetweather.description: Queues a weather change to the default weather for the map.

checkitemroom.description: Checks if the player has enough space in their Bag to hold quantity more of item index. Sets variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT) to 0x0001 if there is room, or 0x0000 is there is no room.

showcontestwinner.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop. (The argument is discarded.)

warp.description: Sends the player to Warp warp on Map bank.map. If the specified warp is 0xFF, then the player will instead be sent to (X, Y) on the map.

givemoney.description: If check is 0x00, this command adds value to the player's money.

multichoice2.description: Displays a multichoice box from which the user can choose a selection, and blocks script execution until a selection is made. Lists of options are predefined and the one to be used is specified with list. The default argument determines the initial position of the cursor when the box is first opened; it is zero-indexed, and if it is too large, it is treated as 0x00. If B is set to a non-zero value, then the user will not be allowed to back out of the multichoice with the B button.

setdooropened.description: Queues the opening of the door tile at (X, Y) with an animation.

cmd8a.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

setvar.description: Changes the value of destination to value.

comparefarbytetobank.description: Compares the byte located at offset a to the least-significant byte of the value of script bank b.

checkdailyflags.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

call.description: Jumps to destination and continues script execution from there. The location of the calling script is remembered and can be returned to later.

testdecoration.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop. (The argument is read, but not used for anything.)

doorchange.description: Executes the state changes queued with setdooropened, setdoorclosed, setdooropened2, and setdoorclosed2.

cmd2c.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

cry.description: Plays the specified (species) Pokémon's cry. You can use waitcry to block script execution until the sound finishes.

hidepokepic.description: Hides all boxes displayed with showpokepic.

goto.description: Jumps to destination and continues script execution from there.

writebytetooffset.description: Sets the byte at offset to value.

comparefarbytes.description: Compares the byte located at offset a to the byte located at offset b.

loadpointer.description: Sets the specified script bank to value.

release.description: If the script was called by a Person event, then that Person's movement will resume. This command also closes any standard message boxes that are still open.

bufferPok\u00e9mon.description: Writes the name of the Pokémon at index species to the specified buffer.

braille2.description: Sets variable 0x8004 to a value based on the width of the braille string at text.

startcontest.description: In FireRed, this command is a nop.

random.description: Stores a random integer between 0 and limit in variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT).

cmd24.description: Replaces a pointer in the script engine RAM with asm_pointer.

closeonkeypress.description: Holds the current message box open until the player presses a key. The message box is then closed.

doweather.description: Executes the weather change queued with resetweather or setweather. The current weather will smoothly fade into the queued weather.

setbyte.description: Pads the specified value to a dword, and then writes that dword to a predefined address (0x0203AAA8).

buffernumber.description: Converts the value of input to a decimal string, and writes that string to the specified buffer.

bufferstring.description: Copies the string at offset to the specified buffer.

checkattack.description: Checks if at least one Pokémon in the player's party knows the specified (index) attack. If so, variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT) is set to the (zero-indexed) slot number of the Pokémon that knows the move. If not, LASTRESULT is set to 0x0006.

checkanimation.description: Blocks script execution until all playing field move animations complete.

cmdc9.description: The exact purpose of this command is unknown, but it is related to the blue help-text box that appears on the bottom of the screen when the Main Menu is opened.

copyscriptbanks.description: Copies the contents of bank source into bank destination.

setanimation.description: Tells the game which party Pokémon to use for the next field move animation.

fadesong.description: Crossfades the currently-playng song into the specified (song_number) song.

trainerbattle.description: If the Trainer flag for Trainer index is not set, this command does absolutely nothing.

bufferfirstPok\u00e9mon.description: Writes the name of the first Pokémon in the player's party to the specified buffer.

setdoorclosed.description: Queues the closing of the door tile at (X, Y) with an animation.

braille.description: Displays the string at pointer as braille text in a standard message box. The string must be formatted to use braille characters.

updatecoins.description: Updates the secondary box spawned by showcoins. (What does it do with its arguments?)

waitmovementpos.description: Apparent clone of waitmovement. Oddly, it doesn't seem to work at all if applied to any Person other than the player (0xFF), and the X and Y arguments don't seem to do anything.

lock.description: If the script was called by a Person event, then that Person's movement will cease.
